Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the decrease in agricultural exports during the last two years of the previous administration by stating it as "over $22 billion" when the actual decrease was $15.3 billion.
Understate: The claim understates the overall increase in agricultural export values under the Obama administration by focusing only on the decrease in the last two years.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the decrease in farm income and agricultural exports during the last two years of the previous administration was solely due to the actions or inaction of the past administrations.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the statement that farm income plummeted by more than $30 billion in the last two years of the previous administration.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that farm incomes are projected to rise by more than $10 billion by the end of the current year.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the decrease in agricultural exports, such as declining commodity prices and a decline in export quantities.
